articles.title: Nokia, Teva Pharmaceutical and Vodafone Are Volatile; Here's Why
Liberty says Vodafone Dutch joint venture 'probably not' a template for more deals
articles.summary: [Reuters] - Liberty Global's chief executive said the cable group's joint venture with mobile operator Vodafone in the Netherlands did not signal more deals between the two companies in Europe. "This was a unique situation," he said at the Barcelona conference on Thursday. Vodafone said on Wednesday regulators could look favourably on more co-operation between the two companies as a counterbalance to former telecom incumbents.

articles.title: Liberty says Vodafone Dutch JV 'probably not' a template for more deals
articles.summary: [Reuters] - Liberty Global's chief executive said the cable group's joint venture with mobile operator Vodafone in the Netherlands did not signal more deals between the two companies in Europe. Vodafone said on Wednesday regulators could look favourably on more co-operation between the two companies as a counterbalance to former telecom incumbents.

articles.title: [$$] Vodafone Data Usage in India Crimped by Competition, Says CEO
Vodafone says regulators might welcome any new Liberty deal
articles.summary: [Reuters] - Vodafone said regulators could look favourably on any wider tie-up between the mobile telecoms giant and cable company Liberty Global in Europe because it would counterbalance the power of former incumbents in Germany, Italy and Britain. "The European Commission has clearly indicated that they like the idea of stronger competitors to former incumbents," Vodafone Chief Executive Vittorio Colao told analysts and investors at a Morgan Stanley industry conference in Barcelona on Wednesday. "They see that in each country there is a KPN, a Telecom Italia (TLIT,MI), a Deutsche Telekom, a BT , that are at the end of the day still incredibly, I would not want to use the word dominant, but let's say influential.

articles.title: Morning News Call - India, November 16
articles.summary: [Reuters] - LIVECHAT- JAPAN MONETARY POLICY with Sayuri Shirai Even as Governor Haruhiku Kuroda has pushed back the timing to achieve Bank of Japan's 2-percent inflation target, the potential of further monetary easing by the central bank continues to draw market attention. Sayuri Shirai, former Bank of Japan board member and current Asian Development Bank visiting researcher discusses the possibilities for the BOJ to change tactics in the wake of the U.S.presidential election and ahead of possible Fed action in its last meeting of 2016 at 12.00 pm. To join the conversation, click on the link: https://forms.thomsonreuters.com/communities/ INDIA TOP NEWS India's cooling retail inflation bolsters rate cut hopes India's retail inflation eased for a third straight month in October, helped by smaller rises in food prices, boosting the chances of an interest rate cut by the central bank next month.

articles.title: PRESS DIGEST- Financial Times - Nov 16
articles.summary: [Reuters] - Ron Dennis was removed as chairman and chief executive of McLaren after falling out with fellow shareholders over the direction of the Formula One technology group. Alphabet Inc's Google announced plans for a new building in the King's Cross area of London and almost double its headcount in the city over the next few years. Mobile telecoms group Vodafone is counting the cost of its Indian foray after it booked an impairment charge of 6.3 billion euros against its local operations to reflect the business it has lost to aggressive new rival Reliance Jio.
